7.1.23  10:18 am   is the grinch his name or his ethnicity or his job?

      it's from a simpler time, when those all 3 were merged.

7.1.23  10:03 am   Is Steve still stuck on the mountains?

      no

7.1.23  10:01 am   are you feeling randy today?

     no, today i feel very much part of an ordered sequence

     i surely am

7.1.23  9:29 am   do you feel like most professional musicians today have lost the love of music that they started out with?

     no

     one of the reasons I chose not to do music as a career was that I was worried it would stress me out by having to make money off of it, and I would stop playing music for the sake of music. but the more I look at and play with ensembles outside of highschool, I get the feeling that a lot of people have gotten into the habit of playing music as a chore, and most ensembles are focused on preparing music for specific gigs, or just being able to play at gigs in general, instead of making music that they like.

     indeed many professional jobs and gigs might bring us to cringetown. but amongst that, thre are many things to learn, about life in general, and besides that, there's also going to be plenty of situations where you come into contact with amazing players and have a great time. It's like speaking. people who speak for a living still enjoy speaking for their own personal reasons, in their own ways

7.1.23  8:03 am   Spoon or Fork?

      there's got to be some sort of middle ground

7.1.23  7:05 am   Opinions on gravity?

      can't live with it, can't live without it

      describe the thing

      casually

     yes

     what about them

      i wouldn't rule it out

      yes, you get soap

6.30.23  12:20 pm   what do you think about

      everything, if i can. (i can't)

6.30.23  12:08 pm   so in "two friends on the beach" the friends arguably take a rather dismissive attitude toward the waiter when he tries to make small talk and such.

     i didn't notice that, nor would i argue it

     my question to you is: is this meant to embody a sort of wariness toward the facades put up by corporations to paint themselves as relatable to the consumer public as a sort of advisory to say "don't be fooled, at the end of the day they just want your money"? or perhaps as a sort of critique of members of the public who consider themselves to be "informed" and aim their misguided aggressions (however tepid)at people who are just as much victims of the machine?

     no. the only time i recall a sort of 'small-talk' sort of thing happening with the waiter is when he says "are you guys friends?" and one friend slyly says 'maybe', almost with a wink. That is a reference to the title, and it also creates some intrigue about the nature of their relationship. The other interaction i recall is when the waiter suggests there are some tables available in the lobster section, and one of the 2 friends gives a sort of uncomfortable reply, this is because of his nervousness/fear about the lobster section as we've already seen before

6.30.23  11:50 am   How can I be super cool and awesome like you are?

      i think with that intention, over time you'll probably end up even better

6.30.23  8:54 am   hi bill. i think i asked a question years ago but i forgot which one. do you think you could answer another question

      sure

6.30.23  7:59 am   what is water?

      i have no idea

6.30.23  6:49 am   hello, i'm currently playing your song "i'm a princess" on my piano. so i got a question. is the chord in 1:52 EADE and then C#? it sounds good enough, but i need your opinion.

     on "tell it to me once", put D in the bass, then you'll have notes D and A in the chord, and the melody goes from G to F# to E. So, to put the chords most tightly with that, you'd have Dsus4 on "tell", Dmaj on "it to", and Dsus2 on "me once". indeed on "me once", a C# note may want to twinkle through. But if i were just playing/accompanying the vocal on one instrument, the C# note probably wouldn't happen. that's probably just happening in the twinkly bells. i assume you are not asking about the "gone" chord because that's at 1:53, and that's a whole different deal

6.30.23  6:31 am   what's the meaning behind I wanna be a movie star???

      written to be a short (looping infinitely, just the chorus title section). a cuddly yet energetic cozy vibe, sparkly eyed, with a lyrical inference to hollywood and the film industry. the rest would be left to the imagination because there would be no verses and no other sections. years later i picked it up and wrote it as a full song, and i further explored those same vibes
